rdfs:label: MetaconceptCombo (Synergistic Combination)
rdfs:comment: Parameterized metaconcept produced by synergistic combination of N parent metaconcepts (N ≥ 2) via n-ary tensor assembly and emergence morphism (⊗ⁿ⇒). The result is a new metaconcept whose semantic identity cannot be reduced to any subset of parents - shared dimensions between parents create multi-way epistemic coupling rather than simple concatenation. First metaconcept in M2 whose tensor formula is structural (parameterized) rather than fixed. Most practical instances use N=2 or N=3 for tractability. Instances are domain-specific and belong to M1 extensions via functor_instantiation.

m2:formulaSemantics.n: Number of parent metaconcepts (n ≥ 2, typically n ∈ {2,3} for practical instances)
m2:formulaSemantics.Mᵢ: i-th parent metaconcept (i = 1..n) - each parent is a parameter
m2:formulaSemantics.M_result: Emergent metaconcept - exists only as synergistic product of all n parents, semantically irreducible to any subset
m2:formulaSemantics.⊗ᵢ₌₁ⁿ: N-ary tensor assembly of parent formulas - shared dimensions create multi-way coupling, not duplication
m2:formulaSemantics.⇒: Emergence morphism (m2:morphism_emergence) - guarantees M_result has properties that no subset of parents possesses alone

m2:couplingRule.description: When parent formulas share dimensions, those dimensions CREATE MULTI-WAY COUPLING across all parents that share them. Coupling complexity increases with number of parents: binary (n=2) yields pairwise coupling, ternary (n=3) yields triplet interactions, n-ary yields n-way coupling. This is the mechanism that produces emergence - the distinction between a naive tensor product (⊗) and a synergistic combination (⊗⇒).

binaryCase.description: Most common case - two parent metaconcepts combine

example.parent_A: ValueSpace = Iₜ ⊗ V ⊗ O ⊗ R ⊗ Iₘ
example.parent_B: Amplification = Fₜ ⊗ D ⊗ Iₜ ⊗ R ⊗ O
example.effect: Iₜ couples territory-information content with amplification signal; R couples representability of value-space with amplification stages; O couples observability of variety with amplification observability. Result is a reduced emergent subspace, not a naive 10D concatenation.

ternaryCase.description: Three parent metaconcepts - creates triplet coupling on shared dimensions
examples: AdaptiveRegulatedLearning = Regulation ⊗ Adaptation ⊗ Memory ⇒ feedback-controlled learning with historical context
ResilientModularEvolution = Resilience ⊗ Modularity ⊗ Evolution ⇒ fault-tolerant systems that adapt structure over time
ContextualAdaptiveControl = Context ⊗ Adaptation ⊗ Regulation ⇒ control that adapts based on environmental state

naryCase.description: Four or more parents - theoretical possibility, rarely used in practice
naryCase.constraint: As n increases, epistemic gap typically increases (harder to verify emergent properties)
naryCase.pragmaticLimit: Most domain instances use n=2 or n=3 for tractability and verifiability
naryCase.dimensionalExplosion: Naive product dimensionality grows as ∏ᵢ dim(Mᵢ), but coupling contraction reduces actual emergent space

m2:nArityCoupling.binaryReduction: When n=2, reduces to M_A ⊗ M_B ⇒ M_C (current dominant pattern)

dimensionalityGrowth.withCoupling: dim(M_result) < ∏ᵢ₌₁ⁿ dim(Mᵢ) due to shared dimension contraction
dimensionalityGrowth.contractionMechanism: Shared dimensions create trace-like contraction: dim(M_result) ≈ ∑ᵢ dim(Mᵢ) - |shared_dimensions| × (n-1)

couplingComplexity.generalKway: C(n,k) potential k-way interactions for k-subsets of parents

m2:nArityCoupling.epistemicChallenge: As n increases, verifiability (V dimension in REVOI) decreases - harder to validate emergent properties against all parent combinations. Trade-off: expressiveness vs. epistemic tractability.

m2:hasExample: VarietyAmplification (n=2, M1_VSM) = MetaconceptCombo(ValueSpace, Amplification) - amplifies variety while preserving epistemic accessibility (VSM S2)
VarietyAttenuation (n=2, M1_VSM) = MetaconceptCombo(ValueSpace, Amplification) - attenuates variety while maintaining verifiability (VSM S3)
RecursiveViability (n=2, M1_VSM) = MetaconceptCombo(Imbrication, Autonomy) - each nested level maintains operational independence
AdaptiveRegulatedLearning (n=3, hypothetical) = MetaconceptCombo(Regulation, Adaptation, Memory) - feedback-controlled learning with historical context
ResilientModularEvolution (n=3, hypothetical) = MetaconceptCombo(Resilience, Modularity, Evolution) - fault-tolerant systems that adapt structure over time
CompositePattern (n=2, Software) = MetaconceptCombo(Modularity, Imbrication) - recursive component trees
EnzymeRegulationCascade (n=2, Biology) = MetaconceptCombo(Regulation, Amplification) - gain-controlled feedback loops
MonetaryPolicy (n=2, Economics) = MetaconceptCombo(ValueSpace, Amplification) - credit expansion within bounded value space

formulaPrimary.role: Evaluate: is the combo representable (R), interoperable across instances (I), and verifiable against parent metaconcepts (V)?
formulaPrimary.note: As n increases, V (verifiability) becomes critical bottleneck

formulaFallback.role: Guaranteed measurement if REVOI fails - structure of the combination, information content, attractor stability of the emergent result

m2:distinctionFromRelated.vs_Composition: Composition (S ⊗ I ⊗ A) = assembly of heterogeneous PARTS into a whole (e.g., atoms → molecule). MetaconceptCombo = assembly of METACONCEPTS with emergence morphism ⇒ - operates at the ontological level, not the structural level.
m2:distinctionFromRelated.vs_Synergy: Synergy (I ⊗ D) = observable combined effect in Territory (1+1>2, e.g., drug synergy). MetaconceptCombo = the MECHANISM that produces synergy at the metaconcept level - Synergy is the phenomenon, MetaconceptCombo is the construction operator.
m2:distinctionFromRelated.vs_Emergence: Emergence (A ⊗ I ⊗ D) = spontaneous appearance of new properties from complex interactions (non-directed). MetaconceptCombo = DIRECTED emergence - parents are explicitly chosen parameters, coupling is predictable from shared dimensions.
m2:distinctionFromRelated.vs_Imbrication: Imbrication (S ⊗ S) = self-similar nesting of IDENTICAL structure. MetaconceptCombo requires n DISTINCT parent metaconcepts (n ≥ 2). Same metaconcept repeated would reduce to Imbrication, not a synergistic combination.
m2:distinctionFromRelated.vs_naiveTensorProduct: Naive ⊗ = simple concatenation of dimension spaces (dim_total = ∑ dim_i). MetaconceptCombo (⊗⇒) = coupled assembly where shared dimensions contract (dim_result < ∑ dim_i), producing irreducible emergent structure.

domains: Cybernetics: VSM S2 VarietyAmplification = ValueSpace ⊗ Amplification (directed variety control, n=2)
Cybernetics: VSM S3 VarietyAttenuation = ValueSpace ⊗ Amplification (directed variety reduction, n=2)
Cybernetics: VSM RecursiveViability = Imbrication ⊗ Autonomy (nested operational independence, n=2)
Software Engineering: Composite pattern = Modularity ⊗ Imbrication (recursive component trees, n=2)
Biology: Enzyme regulation cascade = Regulation ⊗ Amplification (gain-controlled feedback loops, n=2)
Economics: Monetary policy = ValueSpace ⊗ Amplification (credit expansion within bounded value space, n=2)
Control Theory: Cascaded controller = Regulation ⊗ Regulation (nested loops with emergent stability, n=2)
Engineering: Redundant system = Resilience ⊗ Modularity (fault tolerance via independent subsystems, n=2)
Machine Learning: Adaptive ensemble = Adaptation ⊗ Modularity ⊗ Synergy (multiple learners combining with synergistic effect, n=3)
Ecology: Ecosystem resilience = Resilience ⊗ Diversity ⊗ Regulation (multi-species systems with regulatory feedback, n=3)
m2:transdisciplinaryValidation.dominantArity: n=2 (binary combination) in 80% of validated instances
m2:transdisciplinaryValidation.ternaryInstances: n=3 observed in complex adaptive systems (ML ensembles, ecosystems)
m2:transdisciplinaryValidation.transdisciplinaryStrength: Universal - any system requiring controlled synergistic combination of multiple independent capabilities produces a MetaconceptCombo instance. Arity (n) scales with system complexity and coupling requirements.

m2:relationToCategoryTheoryMorphisms.assemblyOperator: ⊗ - pre-existing in m2:categoryTheory as basis for all M2 tensor formulas, extends naturally to n-ary ⊗ᵢ₌₁ⁿ
m2:relationToCategoryTheoryMorphisms.combinedOperator: ⊗ⁿ⇒ - novel unified structural operator for n-ary synergistic combination; both constituents pre-exist independently
m2:relationToCategoryTheoryMorphisms.instantiation: Concrete instances (VarietyAmplification, AdaptiveRegulatedLearning, etc.) produced via functor_instantiation F_inst: Cat_M2 → Cat_M1
m2:relationToCategoryTheoryMorphisms.compositionality: MetaconceptCombo instances can themselves be parents in higher-order combinations, enabling hierarchical emergence

m2:mathematicalNote.emergenceProjector: Can ⇒ (emergence morphism) be formalized as a projector operator P: ⊗ᵢ₌₁ⁿ H_Mᵢ → H_result within the M2 Hilbert space, where H_result ⊂ span(⊗ᵢ₌₁ⁿ H_Mᵢ) but H_result ≠ ⊗ᵢ₌₁ⁿ H_Mᵢ?
m2:mathematicalNote.couplingFormalization: Shared dimensions between parents suggest a trace-like contraction on shared indices, analogous to tensor contraction in differential geometry. For n parents with k shared dimensions: dim(M_result) ≈ (∑ᵢ₌₁ⁿ dim(Mᵢ)) - k(n-1). Testable empirically on existing metaconcept pairs and triples.
m2:mathematicalNote.naryComplexity: As n increases, the contraction structure becomes more complex. Question: does the emergence operator ⇒ impose additional constraints beyond dimensional contraction (e.g., orthogonality, minimality, attractor dynamics)?
m2:mathematicalNote.plausibility: Mathematically plausible as constrained projection with multi-way tensor contraction - pending third-party validation by human expert or independent LLM. Binary case (n=2) is well-validated empirically through existing M1 instances.

dcterms:creator: Echopraxium with the collaboration of Claude AI
m2:discoveryContext: Emerged from VSM modeling requirement: VarietyAmplification and VarietyAttenuation each combine two existing M2 metaconcepts (ValueSpace + Amplification) into a new capability that neither parent provides alone. The pattern is general - any directed synergistic fusion of multiple metaconcepts follows the same structural rule (⊗ⁿ⇒). Formalized as M2 metaconcept to enable systematic instantiation in M1 domain extensions. Originally noted in TO_DO as M1 - corrected to M2 as the generic mechanism belongs at the universal pattern level, while domain-specific instances belong in M1. N-ary generalization (n ≥ 2) added 2026-02-06 to remove artificial binary restriction and enable ternary/higher-order combinations observed in complex adaptive systems.

m2:versionHistory.v2_2026-02-06: Generalized to n-ary combination (n ≥ 2), added ternary examples, formalized coupling complexity, updated mathematical note for multi-way contraction
